```csharp
    ClusterName = "string",
    ResourceGroupName = "string",

    {
        new AzureNative.AzureStackHCI.Inputs.ArcConnectivityPropertiesArgs
        {
            Enabled = false,
            ServiceConfigurations = new[]
            {
```

```go
	ClusterName:                 pulumi.String("string"),
```

```java
var arcSettingResource = new ArcSetting("arcSettingResource", ArcSettingArgs.builder()
    .clusterName("string")
    .resourceGroupName("string")
    .arcApplicationClientId("string")
    .arcApplicationObjectId("string")
    .arcApplicationTenantId("string")
    .arcInstanceResourceGroup("string")
    .arcServicePrincipalObjectId("string")
    .arcSettingName("string")
    .connectivityProperties(ArcConnectivityPropertiesArgs.builder()
        .enabled(false)
        .serviceConfigurations(ServiceConfigurationArgs.builder()
            .port(0)
            .serviceName("string")
            .build())
        .build())
    .build());
```

### Outputs

All [input](#inputs) properties are implicitly available as output properties. Additionally, the ArcSetting resource produces the following output properties:



<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="aggregatestate_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#aggregatestate_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Aggregate<wbr>State</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd>Aggregate state of Arc agent across the nodes in this HCI cluster.</dd><dt class="property-"
            title="">
        <span id="azureapiversion_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#azureapiversion_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Azure<wbr>Api<wbr>Version</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>

## Import



An existing resource can be imported using its type token, name, and identifier, e.g.

```sh
$ pulumi import azure-native:azurestackhci:ArcSetting myresource1 /subscriptions/{subscriptionId}/resourceGroups/{resourceGroupName}/providers/Microsoft.AzureStackHCI/clusters/{clusterName}/arcSettings/{arcSettingName} 
```


To learn more about importing existing cloud resources, see [Importing resources](/docs/using-pulumi/adopting-pulumi/import/).

</dl>
